PS. This is more frantic than Space Marshals, and about on par with Halo for brainless enjoyment. I like all these games, but find Neon Chrome is the most addictive of them all.

title.label: Love this game! Worth the 10 dollars!!

content.label: This is like a newer Robokill style combat setup survival game! Exactly what I was looking for. Lots of replay-ability and every game is randomly generated, so it’s an addicting new adventure every time.

The game is truly fabulous, but the newest update doesn’t add support for the iPhone X. The game is not full screen. 

After reinstalling the game to see if the newest update Finally supported full screen on modern iPhones, I found that my progress was lost. Apparently they don’t utilize iCloud for game saves.
Currently at OS 21, most fun I have had with a top-down shooter in a long time. Smoothly operating, relatively trouble-free game. Thanks!
Game is awesome but I really want Apple TV support badly with iCloud syncing/ come devs lets turn this game into a console game!!!!!
Fun game, solid performer but I switched to an iPhone X and set it up as new. I lost all my progress. I really wish devs would store save game data in the cloud in this day in age.

title.label: A comparison of three two stick shooting games.

content.label:
I bought Neo Chrome, Space Marshall, and Xenowerk. So, let me compare these games. Generally they all have there own merits. They are all well polished, all have great graphics, all belong to top games league in App Store. 
But they all have some problems that make them not worth five stars.
Neo Chrome and Xenowerk are both very repetitive after while, especially Xenowerk, every map is almost the same. Neo Chrome is little better, but not too much. 
For me, the biggest trouble is they both provide only few enemy types. There are only few robots and human in NC, and five or six type of aliens in XW. That is very disappointing. No matter how great the graphics are, how fancy those guns are, shooting same enemies again and again soon becomes very boring. Plus the random created but similar maps, make them even more boring.
And in NC, the enemies’ AI is too low, most time it feels like you are shooting sitting ducks. XW’s enemies are much better. They are very aggressive. But still with only handful types, aggression couldn’t save the game.
SM has, however, a clear storyline. It is less repetitive, less boring. But the trouble is the hero walks like 80-year-old man. The moment I saw that, I’ve already lost interest. It boasts strategies, but I fail to see any. It is just an old man tries to shoot other old men. 
In the end, I couldn’t finish any of these three games. But I’m not gonna say they are not worth the money. Only like most games in App Store, these games are still way behind those great PC games.

Don’t listen to anyone but me because I am the only person qualified to objectively review this game and everyone else is wrong!  

Seriously, I enjoy this game.  Good time waster, catchy music, and nice character customization.  Just a little hard to see on an iPhone 8 plus screen.  

I reviewed this game based on experiences using a controller, so check out others on controls for touch screen since I don’t use them.  I do feel I need to mention the Nimbus controller is correlated to some significant frame rate drops.
Cannot save progress. What modern game does not have such a feature. Get NOVA for free. Its ten times better.
With the newest arena update it erased my save with more than 100+ hours on it! This is super unprofessional! Please fix this 10tons!
superb in every way!!!

Yes
Just pure awesomeness

title.label: Solid game, decent port from console version

content.label: I'll try to keep this short. Just like the tag above says this app is a solid game and the port from the standard console/computer version is decent with enough changes to satisfy the various mobile versions on iOS that it'll potentially play on but without sacrificing much of the original gameplay. There are minor gripes with control but that just a problem with the modern conventions of twin-stick gaming on a mobile device. Besides, you can get a controller and play that way decently enough. So despite the game's learning curve (in which dying is more "when" and not "if" you'll get lose) and the somewhat bland and repetitive graphics, there is an addictive arcade-like quality to the game that sticks even past the end of the game. To the point where a old-fashioned score counter would fit in nicely. (No, the money counter doesn't count) Add that to mood fitting music for the Bladerunner-esque setting and you have a game that is not bad to have in your pocket for 5/10/30 minutes at a time. See some videos for a clearer picture if this is your kind of game however - it's not always very kind game. Old and new school players can appreciate some of this here.
Typical twin stick shooter. More you play, more upgrades you get. Gotta die to get upgrades. Fun!

title.label: A great, immersive twin stick shooter

content.label: I'm not good with words, so I'll just say that there is a lot of fun here for a single price.
Super in depth but easy to pick up and put down. Kinda pricey but totally worth it. Nice RPG touch as well

No IAP, worth the money. 

The only game that comes close to touching this one are those from Klei, like Don't Starve and my favorite invisible Inc.. Well done to the developers for capturing the spirit of old school gaming. Would love to see more from developer on iOS.
Good gameplay, somewhat banal gameplay but if you treat trait selection it's got some game.

title.label: FUN addition to the Top Down Military fps genre

content.label: I play iOS Halo & Xenowork, & I find this a VERY worthy addition to this growing & effective sub-genre of iOS gaming. I find Neon actually less repetitive than Xenowerk, a game whose graphics & gameplay I ❤️ deeply. The levels are really challenging, & the Bosses are really tough, in a fun challenging way. I'm early in, & I'm really impressed. I'm having as much fun with this as I had with iOS Halo, although with a LOT more neon.

I have only been playing this for a short time so far... But I am enjoying it.  Decent controls with external controller.  Wish they could be customized slightly to my liking tho.  I enjoy the music, sound effects and graphics.  It remains to be seen just how randomized the levels are, but so far I have seen a good variety.  It seems the boss levels might be static in design but I'll have to play a lot more to verify that.  I suspect it will take me some time to manage a full playthrough and if the levels do indeed show good randomization then it should be a worthy purchase the will bring hours of fun.
My only wish would be for some control customization. Specifically, a static stick option.
All those things shouldn't work together but they do. Beautifully. Lots of fun.
I only just beat the first boss on floor 6, but it's fun so far. Good music, neat mechanics too.
Shockingly well made twin stick style shooter. Lots of upgrades and different ways to play!
Love this game

title.label: Get Xenowerk, Halo, or Space Marshals instead

content.label:
Get Xenowerk, Space Marshals, Space Marshals 2, Halo Spartan Assault or Halo Spartan Strike instead.  Like Neon Chrome, all five of those games are twin stick shooters, but all five of those games are vasty, vastly better in every way (fun, graphics, controls, setting, gameplay, enemy types, enemy variety, immersion, animations, solidity of combat, weapons, story (for Space Marshals 1 and 2)), presentation, and you can buy any three three of them for less than Neon Chrome costs all by itself.  At 99 cents, Xenoworks is 10 times the game and ten times the fun Neon Chrome is, and it's 1/10th the cost.  You can get both Halo games together for half the cost Neon Chrome is alone, and both are way, way better (the only thing the Halo games are missing is the ability to level up your character).  I've played Xenowerk for hours and plan to play it more (it's a fantastic game that's an absolute steal for what they are charging); I've played Neon Chrome for about 30 minutes and had to force myself to keep playing after the first couple in the hope that it would get better (it didn't).

Xenowerk, both Halo games and both Space Marshal games also support external controllers as well.  All five games have great touchscreen controls that felt better to me than Neon Chrome, but all five are even better with an external controller.  Neon Chrome should at least support MFI controllers.
Good fun

title.label: Best mobile game I've ever played

content.label: This game has every element needed for a game to be entertaining. Not impossible, but difficult enough, an actual storyline, cool weapons, great gameplay and even a great soundtrack. Highly recommend buying this one, well worth the money. Very refreshing change of pace from all the "pay to play" games that have infected the mobile game market. If I had any complaint, and it's not even a complaint really since I figured it out rather quickly, there could be a better tutorial for the controls. Otherwise a five star game. Very well made.
It costs but it's great well worth the investment

title.label: the best game for iPhone I've yet played

content.label: If you're looking to have a proper gaming experience on your iPhone Plus with MFi controller- here it is. Well done, lads. Well done.
This game has the best replay value of any iOS game I've played since Wayward Souls.
Awesome game!
Needed a separate dual stick controller before I really enjoyed it

I usually play this game on PS4, but this is a very respectable port that addresses many of the issues that other twin-stick shooters seem to suffer from. My only complaint is an occasional stutter with the frame rate.

The game itself is first rate. It's a thoughtful evolution of the genre that brings a lot of freshness. You could kind of call it a twin-stick roguelike.
Yo it's awesome game but slim the price to 5 bucks and add co op survival
Brilliant upgrade system with tight controls. Great game !
This is a very well made game. Extremely polished and gameplay is deep. One of the best I've played in a while.

title.label: Great game even for those of us that are not elite shooters

content.label: Twin stick shooters & roguelikes are two styles of game that I always want to like, but usually don't. Neon Chrome bucks that trend thanks to smooth controls, balanced difficulty, and a sense of progression between runs.
